STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 7, 2023
Marci Canales
New Hope Youth Center
1719 E HIGH ST,
MT PLEASANT, MI, 48858-8989
Re: License #: CI370377212
Investigation #: 2023C0000527
Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI370377212
Licensee Group Organization: Youth Opportunity Investments, LLC
Licensee Designee: Tyrene Green
Chief Administrator: Marci CANALES
Agency Name: New Hope Youth Center
Agency Address: 1719 E HIGH ST
MT PLEASANT, MI 48858-8989
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 04/09/2025
Capacity: 15

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident reporting.
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/ legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility is not providing timely notifications of AWOLP.
2

Investigation Interviews:
Worker 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/9/2023. Worker
1 was notified on 6/7/2023 at 1:15pm via telephone from an
unknown staff at New Hope that Youth A had gone AWOLP
(absent without legal permission) from school and was located by
law enforcement however then ran from staff again and was
AWOLP. Worker 1 has been in contact with Worker 3 who
reported Youth B’s parents were not notified of Youth B being
AWOLP.
Worker 2 was interviewed via telephone on 6/14/2023. Worker
2 reported she was not notified of Youth C being AWOLP until
6/7/2023 at 7:30pm when she received an email from the facility
stating Youth C went AWOLP from school and was now back at
the facility which was inaccurate information. Worker 2 reported
she was not notified by Staff 2 on 6/7/2023 at 2pm as the incident
report states. Parent 1 was notified on 6/8/2023 that Youth C was
AWOLP.
Worker 3 was interviewed via telephone on 6/20/2023. Worker
3 reported she was notified of Youth B going AWOLP via email on
6/7/2023 at 7:33pm. The email notification indicated Youth B went
AWOLP from school and was back at the facility. Worker 3
received a follow up email on 6/8/2023 at 7:30am stating there
was miscommunication between staff and Youth B was still
AWOLP. Worker 3 did have a voicemail from Staff 1 on 6/8/2023
at 7:32am. Worker 3 did not have a voicemail from Staff 1 on
6/7/2023. Worker 3 did not call if she had received a call from
Staff 3 on 6/7/2023 at 1:02pm notifying her of Youth B’s AWOLP
as indicated on the incident report. Worker 3 spoke with Parent 2
on 6/8/2023 around 5:30pm and Parent 2 was not aware that
Youth B was still AWOLP.
Parent 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/14/2023. Parent 1
reported he was notified by Staff 1 on 6/8/2023 at 7:44am that
Youth B had gone AWOLP. Parent 1 reported he was not notified
on 6/7/2023 at 2:17pm by Staff 1 as indicated on the incident
report.
Parent 2 was interviewed via telephone on 6/29/2023. Parent 2
reported she was notified by Youth B’s probation officer that Youth
B had gone AWOLP. Parent 2 reported she was not notified by
the facility on 6/7/2023. Parent 2 reported she was informed by
the facility on 6/8/2023 at 7:42am. Parent 2 reported she only has
one contact telephone number. Parent 2 reported she did not
3

receive a voicemail or telephone call from the facility on 6/7/2023
at 2:15pm as indicated on the incident report.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 6/9/2023 and
6/12/2023. Complainant reported she received a copy of the
incident report for Youth A which indicated at the bottom that Staff
1 notified her of the AWOLP on 6/7/2023 at 2:20pm and that this
was inaccurate. Complainant reported she was notified by the
Worker 1 of Youth A being AWOLP and Complainant called New
Hope Youth Center around 2:20pm and spoke with an unknown
female staff who informed Complainant the facility was having
phone and internet issues. Complainant told the unknown female
staff she was calling due to being informed by Worker 1 Youth A
was AWOLP. The unknown female staff told Complainant she
could not give her any information and would contact her back.
Complainant reported she did not speak with Staff 1 at any time
on 6/7/2023. Complainant spoke with Staff 1 on 6/8/2023 around
7:50am regarding concerns of misinformation as Complainant was
told Youth A had returned from AWOLP when she had not.
Complainant reported she is concerned for the safety of Youth A.
Complainant reported Youth A was placed at New Hope on
2/28/2023 and began school on 3/8/2023. Youth A has had low
grades and Complainant is concerned about the facility monitoring
Youth A’s school progress. New Hope did not mark a box on the
school paperwork for Complainant to be notified regarding Youth
A’s progress in school. Complainant reported Youth A was
suspended and New Hope reported Youth A would lose privileges
as a consequence of the suspension however was taken on
outings such as to a dog show. Complainant is concerned with the
facilities follow through. Complainant is concerned about
situations at the facility over Memorial Day weekend regarding riot
like conditions (this is being investigated in SI 2023C0000495).
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 6/20/2023. Staff
1 reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C were located at the school
and were refusing to return to the facility. Staff and law
enforcement were attempting to talk with the youth to get them to
return. Law enforcement left and staff continued to attempt to get
the youth to return. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C refused and
began walking away from staff. Staff lost sight of the youth. Staff
1 reported he believed he made notification calls to Parent 1,
Parent 2, Worker 1, Worker 2. Staff 1 made the notifications from
the facility house phone. Staff 1 reported he did not reach Parent
1, Parent 2, Worker 1, or Worker 2, so he left messages between
2pm-3:45pm. Staff 1 provided the times he attempted contacts to
the staff who completed the incident reports to include in the
4

notification section. Staff 1 checked the call history on the facility
phone to see if the calls were still in the call history and stated
they were not as the call history only went back to 6/15/2023. Staff
1 spoke with Complainant on 6/7/2023 around 6:30pm and
provided her an update. On 6/8/2023 around 6:30am Staff 1
called Complainant, Parent 1, Parent 2, Worker 1, Worker 2 and
Worker 3 to provide updates on his cell phone.
Staff 2 was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 6/16/2023. Staff
2 reported she went to pick up Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
from school and they were not there. Staff 2 walked through the
school looking for the youth and spoke with the school police
officer who was assisting in looking for the youth. Staff 2 went
back to the facility to start making notifications of the youth being
AWOLP. Staff 2 called Worker 1 at approximately 12:20pm and
was leaving Worker 1 a message when she received a call from
the school police officer stating he had located Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C. Staff 2 stopped notifications at this time. Staff 2
reported she had a personal appointment and left the facility
around 12:30pm. Staff 2 handed off the AWOLP packets she had
started and a sticky note with the telephone call she made to
Worker 1 to the shift supervisor. Staff 2 reported when she left
the facility, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C had been located and
staff were with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C trying to get them
to return to the facility. Staff 2 reported she thought there may
have been some confusion on who was doing the notifications as
she started the notifications however then the youth were found so
she stopped and had to leave for a personal appointment.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 6/29/2023 via Team Meeting. Staff
3 reported she was working on 6/7/2023 at the facility when Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C went AWOLP. Staff 3 was at the facility
with other youth. Staff 3 was asked to make notification to the
youth’s workers. Staff 3 reported she did call and left messages
for two of the youth’s workers however did not recall which
workers. Staff 3 believed she contacted the workers towards the
end of her shift which was 2pm. Staff 3 made the notification calls
from her personal cell phone due to the facility phone being in use
by others at the time. Staff 3’s phone log did not go back to
6/7/2023. Staff 3 provided the workers and times she called to the
supervisor for the incident report documentation.
Documents Reviewed:
• New Hope Youth Center AWOLP Response Plan states in
the event of an AWOLP from the facility immediate
notification to law enforcement, MISACWIS, and MDHHS
5

staff are required. The facility administrator or designee
shall notify the youth’s parent or guardian immediately after
determining a youth is AWOLP.
• New Hope Youth Center Incident Report dated 6/7/2023 for
Youth A: Staff went to pick youth up from school on
6/7/2023 at approximately 11:00am however Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C were not there. Staff 2 conducted a
thorough search of the school and was unable to locate the
youth. Staff 2 notified the facility at 11:18am. The facility
contacted law enforcement at 11:35am to report the
AWOLP. Central dispatch contacted the facility at 11:45am
stating Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C had been located.
Staff went to where law enforcement was with the youth.
The youth refused to return to the facility. Staff lost sight of
the youth at approximately 1:50pm and returned to the
facility and reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
AWOLP to law enforcement at 2:02pm. Staff 1 notified
Complainant on 6/7/2023 at 2:20pm.
• New Hope Youth Center Incident Report dated 6/7/2023 for
Youth B: Was consistent with Youth A’s incident report.
Staff 3 notified Worker 3 on 6/7/2023 at 1:02pm. Staff 1
notified Parent 2 on 6/7/2023 at 2:15pm.
• New Hope Youth Center Incident Report dated 6/7/2023 for
Youth C: Was consistent with Youth A’s incident report.
Staff 2 notified Worker 1 on 6/7/2023 at 2pm. Staff 1
notified Parent 1 on 6/7/2023 at 2:17pm.
• Email notification to Worker 1 dated 6/7/2023 at 7:30pm
stating Youth C went AWOLP from school.
• Screen shot of Staff 2’s telephone call log showing she
contacted Worker 1 on 6/7/2023 at 12:23pm and was on
the call for one minute and thirty-eight seconds.
• Screen shot of Parent 2’s telephone call log showing she
did not have a call from the facility or anyone around 2pm.
• Screen shot of Parent 2’s voicemail log showing she did not
have any voicemails on 6/7/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as the facility did not
immediately report the youth being AWOLP to the parents and the
referring agency as Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C went AWOLP
from school and the facility learned of this around 11am when
Staff 2 went to pick up the youth. Staff 2 looked for the youth and
notified the facility at 11:18am that the youth were unable to be
located. The facility was notified around 11:45am by central
dispatch the youth were located. Staff went to get the youth,
6

however the youth refused to return to the facility and staff lost
sight of the youth around 1:50pm and returned to the facility and
reported the youth AWOLP to law enforcement at 2:02pm. Worker
2 and Worker 3 reported they were not notified of the AWOLP until
6/7/2023 at approximately 7:30pm via email. Parent 1 reported he
was not notified by the facility of the AWOLP until the following
day 6/8/2023 at 7:44am. Parent 2 reported she was not notified by
the facility of the AWOLP until the following day 6/8/2023 at
7:42am. Complainant reported she was informed by Worker 1
about the AWOLP and called the facility around 2:20pm and was
informed the facility was having phone and internet issues and
she would be called back. Complainant asked about the youth
being AWOLP and was informed by an unknown staff that they
could not provide any information.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR2023C0000495 dated 07/05/2023, CAP Pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
7/7/2023
______________________________________
Jennifer Pastorick Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 7, 2023
